About the Aberdeenshire, Scotland, Police Records 1818-1948

General collection information

This collection captures 130 years' worth of records kept by the police in Aberdeenshire, Scotland. Formed in 1818, the Aberdeen City Police documented criminal activity in the city through detailed registers and crime statistics. The collection includes the following:

Wanted Posters

Registers for Detention, Offenders, and Complaints

Annual reports on crime statistics in the area.

City Police Register of Returned Convicts, 1869-1939

The Register of Returned Convicts includes physical descriptions and even photographs of the convicts. The Detention and Offender registers include crimes committed by youths.

The Aberdeen City Police not only kept documentation on its criminals, but also on its own employees and legal proceedings in Aberdeen. This collection also has police employment records and papers that showcase daily life within Aberdeenshireâ€”from complaint registers to public accident statistics to sheep dipping.

Using this collection

The types of records within this collection vary, but they can provide the following details about convicts or police personnel in Aberdeenshire:

Name

Alias(es)

Age

Birth date and place

Death date and place

Conviction date [for convict]

Discharge date [for convict]

Employment details

Rank [for police officers]

Residence

Names of parents

Name of spouse

If you have an ancestor in Aberdeen who wasn't a policeman or a criminal, this collection can still be helpful. The police also documented legal disputes and proceedings that your ancestor may have taken part in. These records can include your ancestor's name, residence, and even a description of their property.

Collection in context

The Aberdeen City Police was founded by the Aberdeen Police Act in 1818. Before then, the city only had a Police Commissioner who didn't have the resources to enforce the law. The police force started out with Day and Night Patrols, which merged into one organisation in 1840. The police force was a new concept in 19th century Scotland, and their duties focused on road maintenance, street lighting, and sewage as well as apprehending criminals.

Burghs and counties in Scotland created their own salaried police forces that were empowered to gather statistics and new methods in crime detection. The evolution of the Aberdeen City Police can be seen through the records in this collection.
